response:
Urgent neuroimaging is required to visualize the lesions and assess for dissemination in space (a key criterion for MS). Lumbar puncture and specific serology are necessary to distinguish between MS, NMO/MOG, and infectious or systemic autoimmune mimics.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Whole Spine with contrast (including orbits)", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Serum Glucose", "Anti-Aquaporin 4 antibodies (NMO-IgG)", "Anti-MOG antibodies", "ANA and ENA screen", "Syphilis serology", "HIV serology", "Lyme disease serology", "Serum ACE", "Vitamin B12 and Folate", "Lumbar Puncture (for CSF oligoclonal bands, protein, glucose, cell count, viral PCR)", "Midstream urine culture", "Visual Evoked Potentials (VEP)"]
